resources.string: Espresso poured on a vanilla ice cream. Served in a cappuccino cup.

Espresso with added hot water (100-150 ml). Often served in a cappuccino cup. (The espresso is added into the hot water rather than all the water being flowed through the coffee that would lead to over extraction.)
A tall, mild \'milk coffee\' (about 150-300 ml). An espresso with steamed milk and only a little milk foam poured over it. Serve in a latte glass or a coffee cup. Flavored syrup can be added.
A classic Italian coffee with equal parts espresso, steamed milk, and milk foam (about 150 ml). Traditionally topped with cocoa powder or cinnamon. Served in a cappuccino cup.
A strong, concentrated coffee brewed by forcing hot water through finely ground coffee beans. Typically served in a small demitasse cup (25â€“30 ml).
An espresso-based drink with velvety microfoam. Similar to a latte but with less milk and more espresso flavor. Popular in Australia and New Zealand. Served in a small cup (150 ml).
A delicious mix of espresso, steamed milk, and chocolate syrup. Often topped with whipped cream or cocoa powder. Served in a tall glass or large coffee cup.
